definition: Hmong or Miao ethnic group of southwest China/surname Miao

sentences.english: We began to rake over the seedbed while they were selecting the seeds.
sentences.chinese: 在他们选种时，我们开始耙平苗床。

sentences.english: Rice, cotton and vegetable seeds are sometimes grown in special seedbeds.
sentences.chinese: 有时，大米，棉花和蔬菜种子要在苗床培育。

sentences.english: Mid spring until early summer in seedbed and plant out in late autumn.
sentences.chinese: 在春天到今年夏天早些时候，中期和植物从苗床深秋。

sentences.english: Cutting winter insulation to do a good job seedbed of work.
sentences.chinese: 冬季扦插要做好苗床的保温工作。

sentences.english: They raked the soil smooth for a seedbed.
sentences.chinese: 他们将土耙平作为苗床。

sentences.english: They fenced the seedbeds from the north wind.
sentences.chinese: 他们为苗床筑篱挡住北风。

sentences.english: The gardeners fenced the seedbeds from the north wind.
sentences.chinese: 园丁们为苗床筑篱以遮北风。

sentences.english: If possible, the seedbed should be kept evenly moist until germination occurs.
sentences.chinese: 如果可以，苗床要保持湿润，直到草种均匀发芽。

definition: to sprout/to come out (of seedling)/to bud
to soak seeds (to make them germinate)
small plot of farm land/Taiwan pr. [xi1]
to protect young plants, ensuring that enough survive to produce a good crop
